review: Fantastic for college students without a DVD player. I love Google and Netflix, so this review might be a bit biased, but overall I don't have too many issues with Chromecast. One issue is the slow response time of just casting a tab from your browser. It's about a second off so you can't really watch video just from sites like projectfreetv because the audio will be out of sync. It connects fast, it is great with apps for playing music, etc. And I LOVE the backgrounds. They constantly update and you get a new beautiful background on your television whenever you're not casting. I give it 5 stars because it's the best way to stream my favorite shows on my actual hi-def television.

review: I bought Apple TV and Google Chromecast at the same time for 2 different TV sets.Google TV really disappoints me.Sometimes on my smartphone when I hit Cast button, it simply freezes. It absolutely doesn't respond. Sometimes, it shows "This Phone" and "Apple TV" with no choice of "Google TV". Other times, it does show Google. It seems to be completely random.When I do get lucky to get in and enjoy my show, It frequently shows loading symbol and freezes. This can go on every few minutes, to the point that I simply can't watch the show. Sometimes it will just completely time out and stop.I know this is a Chromecast issue because my Apple TV never had this problem and I also have a smart TV that I can always watch movies flawlessly.  If it is not the content provider, not my networking bandwidth, then it has to be the device.The lack of Google support is another problem. Google is a technology company. They do all kinds of cool things, but they never have the notion of "customer service". There is nobody to call and no where to write to about all of my issues. All I can do is just Google to find my own answers which also failed.So far the product seems to be totally unusable to me.Stay away from a product that the manufacturer does not stand behind to support it!
